typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Header
typeDescription.description: The Header type stores bibliographic information. All this information is on the document (i.e. the document that we are working on).

featureDescription.name: docType
featureDescription.description: the type document we are working on. Currently, there are only two values (abstract or full text), however, we might add others here, such as e.g. randomized (randomly selected sentences due to copyright reasons), C

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: where the document was taken from (e.g. PubMed), C

featureDescription.name: docId
featureDescription.description: the identifier of this document with respect to its source. E.g: PMID in PubMed. In combination with the source, this is a unique identifier for a document, C

featureDescription.name: uri
featureDescription.description: a reference to the original document if available, O

featureDescription.name: copyright
featureDescription.description: any copyright information, could be useful when we want to display text mining results (especially when working on full texts) , C

featureDescription.name: truncated
featureDescription.description: indicates whether the document is truncated (which is often the case with abstracts), C

featureDescription.name: authors
featureDescription.description: all authors of the document, (though this is contained as a separate zone in document structure, but meta info should be self contained), O

featureDescription.name: title
featureDescription.description: all authors of the document, (though this is contained as a separate zone in document structure, but meta info should be self contained), O

featureDescription.name: pubTypeList
featureDescription.description: a collection of objects of type uima.julielab.uima.PubType, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.pubmed.Header
typeDescription.description: The Header type stores bibliographic information. All this information is on the document (i.e. the document that we are working on). A document might also be only an abstract or a part of a full text. Typically, there is a proper publication for such a document. Information on the publication is stored using org.bootstrep.typesPubType.

featureDescription.name: citationStatus
featureDescription.description: indicates the stage of citation of a document; the allowed values are taken from medline also. See ML for a detailed description of the allowed values.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PubType
typeDescription.description: an abstract type, that should be used to store information on the publication. Might be extended later on depending on our needs. At first, we only add a subtype (Journal) and an accumulative type (OtherPub)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Journal
typeDescription.description: This type contains attributes to describe a journal publication. Refer to ML for a detailed description of this type and its attributes and values.

featureDescription.name: ISSN
featureDescription.description: the international standard serial number, O

featureDescription.name: volume
featureDescription.description: the volume number of the journal in which the article was published, O

featureDescription.name: pubDate
featureDescription.description: full date on which the issue of the journal was published, O

featureDescription.name: title
featureDescription.description: ull journal title, C

featureDescription.name: impactFactor
featureDescription.description: the impact factor of the journal at the time of publication, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Date
typeDescription.description: type to store dates

featureDescription.name: day
featureDescription.description: day of the month, C

featureDescription.name: month
featureDescription.description: month of the year, C

featureDescription.name: year
featureDescription.description: full year (e.g. 2006 and NOT 06), C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Annotation
typeDescription.description: super type for all Annotation types (see subtypes)

featureDescription.name: id
featureDescription.description: unique identifier

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: the component that made the annotation might put its confidence/score calculated internally here

featureDescription.name: componentId
featureDescription.description: marks which NLP component has been used to derive the annotation

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.OtherPub
typeDescription.description: accumulative type for all other types of publications

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Descriptor
typeDescription.description: an abstract type for descriptors, there are two subclasses: one for automatically acquired meta information and one for meta information that was added manually (such as e.g. MeSH term lists)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.AutoDescriptor
typeDescription.description: the descriptor type for automatically (i.e. algorithmically) acquired meta information. This is just a first proposal of possible features. It will be refined and extendes as soon as more experience is available in the project context.

featureDescription.name: molecularEntities
featureDescription.description: (molecular) entities being of interest within this document/publication, O

featureDescription.name: diseaseID
featureDescription.description: ICD codes of diseases described in this publication, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.ManualDescriptor
typeDescription.description: the descriptor type for manually added information.

featureDescription.name: meSHList
featureDescription.description: a collection of objects of type uima.julielab.uima.MeSHHeading, O

featureDescription.name: chemicalList
featureDescription.description: a collection of objects of type uima.julielab.uima.Chemical, O

featureDescription.name: dBInfoList
featureDescription.description: a collection of objects of type uima.julielab.uima.DBInfo, O

featureDescription.name: keywordList
featureDescription.description: a collection of objects of type uima.julielab.uima.Keyword, O

featureDescription.name: geneSymbolList
featureDescription.description: GeneSymbolList in PubMed

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.MeshHeading
typeDescription.description: Medical Subject Headings, see ML or NLM's MeSH for a detailed description.

featureDescription.name: descriptorName
featureDescription.description: C

featureDescription.name: qualifierName
featureDescription.description: C

featureDescription.name: descriptorNameMajorTopic
featureDescription.description: C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Chemical
typeDescription.description: a chemical type contains to features, both are compulsory, see ML for further information.

featureDescription.name: RegistryNumber
featureDescription.description: a unique 5 to 9 digit number in hyphenated format assigned by the Chemical Abstract Service to specify chemical substances, a zero is a valid number when an actual number cannot be located or is not yet available., C

featureDescription.name: NameOfSubstance
featureDescription.description: the name of the substance that the registry number or the E.C. number identifies., C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.DBInfo
typeDescription.description: References to other databases, e.g. SwissProt, INTERPRO e.g.

featureDescription.name: name
featureDescription.description: the name of the DB referred to, the list of allowed values will have to be specified during the next months and in collaboration with other project partners, e.g. EBI

featureDescription.name: acList
featureDescription.description: a list of accession numbers for this DB, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Keyword
typeDescription.description: a term of a controlled keyword list to describe the content of the publication.

featureDescription.name: name
featureDescription.description: C

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: the keyword list from which this keyword was taken, e.g. O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Language
typeDescription.description: the language of the document. Possible values: based on ISO-639-1 language codes; we start with a first selection (which might be extended later).

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.DBName
typeDescription.description: the name of the DB referred to, the list of allowed values will have to be specified during the next months and in collaboration with other project partners, e.g. EBI

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Style
typeDescription.description: text-markup information (italic, bold etc.) on any (e.g. character) level. Allows to keep the original style markup of the text, several style types might be set to same (or overlapping) range, when different styles are set to same text region.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Encoding
typeDescription.description: Encoding Information

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Zone
typeDescription.description: A Zone is a distinct division of text. It is an abstract Type and provides a parent type for sub-types which represent various kinds of zones.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Paragraph
typeDescription.description:
a paragraph is a self-contained unit of a discourse in a written text dealing with a particular point or idea, or the words of a speaker (see Wikipedia encyclopedia: http://encyclopedia.thefreedictionary.com/paragraph). Thus, this is an important text unit for semantic analysis in text mining and IR/IE.
Positional Aggregation: Paragraph Type consists of one or more Sentences.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Title
typeDescription.description: Title Type annotates titles covering various text units, including the whole paper, sections and subsections etc. Title Type can be used as a feature of other types, such as Meta Type or Section Type. Positional Aggregation: Title Type contains a Paragraph Type.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.AuthorInfo
typeDescription.description: AuthorInfo Type annotates the text segment containing the information about an author and his/her affiliation information.

featureDescription.name: foreName
featureDescription.description: An author’s name,C

featureDescription.name: affiliation
featureDescription.description: Affiliation of the author, O

featureDescription.name: contact
featureDescription.description: Contact information (emails, phones, etc.), O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Sentence
typeDescription.description: This annotation marks the span of a sentence.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Token
typeDescription.description: Token annotation marks the span of a token and takes all additional annotations that are on the token level, including Part-of-Speech information, lemma, stemmed form, grammatical features such as gender, number and orthographical information; furthemore Token includes the information about dependency relations to other tokens (see correspondent annotation types for further infromation).

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: see Lemma, O

featureDescription.name: posTag
featureDescription.description: List contains part-of-speech tags of different part-of-speech Tagsets (see also POSTag and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: stemmedForm
featureDescription.description: Contains the stemmed form of current token (see StemmedForm), O

featureDescription.name: feats
featureDescription.description: Contains grammatical features correspondent to the part-of-speech tag of current token (see GrammaticalFeats and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: orthogr
featureDescription.description: see de.julielab.jules.types.Orthogrpahy

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.POSTag
typeDescription.description: POS is a linguistic category of words (tokens) that are defined by their particular syntactic/morphological behaviours (e.g. noun, verb).

featureDescription.name: tagsetId
featureDescription.description: Every POS TagSet (see subtypes) has an identifier, C

featureDescription.name: language
featureDescription.description: The language identifer, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PennPOSTag
typeDescription.description: The Penn Treebank Tag Set* in Mitchell P. Marcus, Beatrice Santorini, and Mary Ann Marcinkiewicz: Building a Large Annotated Corpus of English: The Penn Treebank, in Computational Linguistics, Volume 19, Number 2 (June 1993), pp. 313--330 (Special Issue on Using Large Corpora). TagsetId 0

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.GeniaPOSTag
typeDescription.description: Genia Tag Set in Tateisi, Yuka and Jun'ichi Tsujii. (2004). Part-of-Speech Annotation of Biology Research Abstracts. In the Proceedings of 4th International Conference on Language Resource and Evaluation (LREC2004). IV. pp. 1267-1270. TagsetId 1

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PennBioIEPOSTag
typeDescription.description: POS is a linguistic category of words (tokens) that are defined by their particular syntactic/morphological behaviours (e.g. noun, verb). TagsteId 2

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Lemma
typeDescription.description: Lemma is the canonical form of a lexeme. Lemma can be retrived from lexicon or be produced by lemmatizer. The lemma value for avtivates is activate

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of lemma,C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.StemmedForm
typeDescription.description: Represents a grammatical morpheme, identifies the morpheme's base form for the current token, activat- for activation. Different forms can be produced by Stemmers.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of the stemmed form, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Simplex
typeDescription.description: Represents a morpheme of a compound.

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: The lemma of simplex, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Abbreviation
typeDescription.description: an abbreviation is a letter or group of letters, taken from a word or words. For example, the word "abbreviation" can be abbreviated as "abbr." or "abbrev."

featureDescription.name: expan
featureDescription.description: The full form of an abbreviation. For example he fullform, for example for HLA (human leukocyte anitigene), O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Acronym
typeDescription.description: Abbreviation includes acronyms “written as the initial letter or letters of words, and pronounced on the basis of this abbreviated written form.”

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.GrammaticalFeats
typeDescription.description: describes a word structure, default grammatical features dependent of a word category, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: language
featureDescription.description: Language identifier, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.NounFeats
typeDescription.description: describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a noun

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender, C

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case. C

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.VerbFeats
typeDescription.description: describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a verb

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.AdjectiveFeats
typeDescription.description: describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a adjective

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PronounFeats
typeDescription.description: describes a word structure, default grammatical features of pronouns

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.DiscontinuousAnnotation
typeDescription.description: chains multiple annotation of the same type, annotates in this way discontinuous objects such as ellipses (protein A, B)

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Annotations to chain

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Chunk
typeDescription.description: Results of the chunking (shallow Parsing (see Abney))

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Relation
typeDescription.description: Relation Annotation

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.DependencyRelation
typeDescription.description: general dependency relation annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: Head (Token) of the analysed dependency relation, C

featureDescription.name: projective
featureDescription.description: The dep. realtions can be projective or not, C

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: Tag Set for dependency relations in SetA (resulting from the use of head rules on Penn Treebank, C

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Constituent
typeDescription.description: general constituent annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: parent
featureDescription.description: parent in a graph, C

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: head can be extracted with head rules, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PTBConstituent
typeDescription.description: Penn Treebank constituent annotation (see Penn Treebank)

featureDescription.name: ref
featureDescription.description: reference from the null constituent to the lexicalized one

featureDescription.name: map
featureDescription.description: in the case of gapping the reference to the corresponding constituent

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.GENIAConstituent
typeDescription.description: GENIA Treebank constituent annotation (see GENIA)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PennBioIEConstituent
typeDescription.description: Penn Treebank constituent annotation (see Penn Treebank)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Orthography
typeDescription.description: As more than one value might apply to a token, there is a StringList that can be filled with all values that apply for this token.

value.description: Every character is a lowercase letter: token
Every character is an uppercase letter: TOKEN
The first character is an uppercase letter; all other characters are lowercase letters: Token
There is more than one uppercase letter in the token: ToKEn
The token is a single uppercase letter: T
with one or more hyphens: token-token
The token is a single uppercase letter followed by a dot: T.
The token is an arithmetic or algebraic operator
The token is an opening or closing bracket, brace, parenthesis
The token is any sequence of characters that does not match any of the above descriptions

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.LexiconEntry
typeDescription.description: The link to the Lexicon. An lexicon entry can be completely retrieved in CAS.

featureDescription.name: entryId
featureDescription.description: The ID of the entry in Lexicon, C

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The source of the entry, C

featureDescription.name: version
featureDescription.description: The version of the source, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.DepRelationSetACat
typeDescription.description: Tag Set for dependency relations in SetA (resulting from the use of head rules on Penn Treebank

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.DepRelationSetBCat
typeDescription.description: Tag Set for dependency relations in SetB

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PTBConstituentCat
typeDescription.description: Category Tag Set of Penn Treebank Constituents

value.description: simple declarative clause, i.e. one that is not introduced by a (possible empty) subordinating conjunction or a wh-word and that does not exhibit subject-verb inversion.
Clause introduced by a (possibly empty) subordinating conjunction.
Direct question introduced by a wh-word or a wh-phrase. Indirect questions and relative clauses should be bracketed as SBAR, not SBARQ.
Inverted declarative sentence, i.e. one in which the subject follows the tensed verb or modal.
Inverted yes/no question, or main clause of a wh-question, following the wh-phrase in SBARQ.ADJP - Adjective Phrase.
Interjection. Corresponds approximately to the part-of-speech tag UH.
Not a Constituent; used to show the scope of certain prenominal modifiers within an NP.
Used within certain complex NPs to mark the head of the NP. Corresponds very roughly to N-bar level but used quite differently.
Particle. Category for words that should be tagged RP.
Quantifier Phrase (i.e. complex measure/amount phrase); used within NP.
Wh-adjective Phrase. Adjectival phrase containing a wh-adverb, as in how hot.
Wh-adverb Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing a wh-adverb such as how or why.

Wh-noun Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing some wh-word, e.g. who, which book, whose daughter, none of which, or how many leopards.
Wh-prepositional Phrase. Prepositional phrase containing a wh-noun phrase (such as of which or by whose authority) that either introduces a PP gap or is contained by a WHNP.
Unknown, uncertain, or unbracketable. X is often used for bracketing typos and in bracketing the...the-constructions.
adverbial - marks a constituent other than ADVP or PP when it is used adverbially (e.g. NPs or free ("headless" relatives).
(nominal) - marks free ("headless") relatives and gerunds when they act nominally.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.GramRole
typeDescription.description: Grammatical Role

value.description: dative- marks the dative object in the unshifted form of the double object construction.
logical subject - is used to mark the logical subject in passives. It attaches to the NP object of by and not to the PP node itself.
predicate - marks any predicate that is not VP. In the do so construction, the so is annotated as a predicate.
marks the locative complement of put.
surface subject - marks the structural subject of both matrix and embedded clauses, including those with null subjects.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Adverbial
typeDescription.description: Adverbials

value.description: benefactive - marks the beneficiary of an action (attaches to NP or PP).
direction - marks adverbials that answer the questions "from where?" and "to where?"
extent - marks adverbial phrases that describe the spatial extent of an activity.
locative - marks adverbials that indicate place/setting of the event.
manner- marks adverbials that indicate manner, including instrument phrases.
purpose or reason - marks purpose or reason clauses and PPs.
temporal- marks temporal or aspectual adverbials that answer the questions when, how often, or how long.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.Misc
typeDescription.description: Miscellaneous

value.description: closely related - marks constituents that occupy some middle ground between arguments and adjunct of the verb phrase.
(cleft) - marks it-clefts ("true clefts") -HLN (headline) - marks headlines and datelines.
(title) - is attached to the top node of a title when this title appears inside running text.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.PennNull
typeDescription.description: marks values of null elements. If the element is not null, the defualt value is null

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jules.types.GENIANull
typeDescription.description: marks values of null elements. If the element is not null, the defualt value is null

value.description: simple declarative clause, i.e. one that is not introduced by a (possible empty) subordinating conjunction or a wh-word and that does not exhibit subject-verb inversion.
Clause introduced by a (possibly empty) subordinating conjunction.
Direct question introduced by a wh-word or a wh-phrase. Indirect questions and relative clauses should be bracketed as SBAR, not SBARQ.
Inverted declarative sentence, i.e. one in which the subject follows the tensed verb or modal.
Inverted yes/no question, or main clause of a wh-question, following the wh-phrase in SBARQ.ADJP - Adjective Phrase.
Not a Constituent; used to show the scope of certain prenominal modifiers within an NP.
Particle. Category for words that should be tagged RP.
Quantifier Phrase (i.e. complex measure/amount phrase); used within NP.
Wh-adjective Phrase. Adjectival phrase containing a wh-adverb, as in how hot.
Wh-adverb Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing a wh-adverb such as how or why.

Wh-noun Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing some wh-word, e.g. who, which book, whose daughter, none of which, or how many leopards.
Wh-prepositional Phrase. Prepositional phrase containing a wh-noun phrase (such as of which or by whose authority) that either introduces a PP gap or is contained by a WHNP.
Used to specify the null complementizer
simple declarative clause, i.e. one that is not introduced by a (possible empty) subordinating conjunction or a wh-word and that does not exhibit subject-verb inversion.
Clause introduced by a (possibly empty) subordinating conjunction.
Direct question introduced by a wh-word or a wh-phrase. Indirect questions and relative clauses should be bracketed as SBAR, not SBARQ.
Inverted declarative sentence, i.e. one in which the subject follows the tensed verb or modal.
Inverted yes/no question, or main clause of a wh-question, following the wh-phrase in SBARQ.ADJP - Adjective Phrase.
Particle. Category for words that should be tagged RP.
Quantifier Phrase (i.e. complex measure/amount phrase); used within NP.
Wh-adjective Phrase. Adjectival phrase containing a wh-adverb, as in how hot.
Wh-adverb Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing a wh-adverb such as how or why.

Wh-noun Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing some wh-word, e.g. who, which book, whose daughter, none of which, or how many leopards.
Wh-prepositional Phrase. Prepositional phrase containing a wh-noun phrase (such as of which or by whose authority) that either introduces a PP gap or is contained by a WHNP.
